snippet: The 1984 commercial “Morning in America” is considered one of the most effective campaign spots ever broadcast, and it most likely cemented Reagan’s re-election.
abstract: Michael Beschloss Historysource column recounts importance of television ad 'Morning in America' to Ronald Reagan's 1984 re-election campaign; notes broadcast spot, which used sentiment to obscure country’s economic recession, was created by custom team of advertising experts; notes single ad is unlikely to achieve same residence in current presidential election.
lead_paragraph: The 1984 commercial “Morning in America” is considered one of the most effective campaign spots ever broadcast, and it most likely cemented Reagan’s re-election.

headline.print_headline: How Reagan Sold Good Times to an Uncertain Nation
headline.main: The Ad That Helped Reagan Sell Good Times to an Uncertain Nation
